p: The lipid peroxidation marker, TBARS, was significantly ( p ≤ 0.001) augmented, while the endogenous antioxidant, GSH, was significantly ( p ≤ 0.001) repressed in diabetic animals as compared with the control group. Both doses of L. regularis (150 and 300 mg/kg) significantly inhibited TBARS level ( p ≤ 0.01 and p ≤ 0.001, respectively) and raised GSH concentration ( p ≤ 0.05 and p ≤ 0.01, respectively) in hepatic tissues from diabetic animals as compared with the STZ group ( Figure 4).
